Description of incident: Mississippi education officials said Monday that a recently disclosed data breach by a testing vendor has exposed information from 663 students in Tupelo and Jefferson County.State Superintendent Carey Wright said that Questar Assessment believes an unauthorized user gained access to records from 2016 tests for 490 students at Tupelo Middle School, 72 at Tupelo High School and 101 at Jefferson County Junior High on Dec. 31 or Jan. 1.Among the items exposed were student names, state identification numbers, grade levels, teacher names and test results. Mississippi officials say they don't share addresses or Social Security numbers with Questar.
